bow: do the positives of pregnancy outweigh the negatives or would you prefer to have had your baby delivered by stork feeling him kick and move around was the best feeling ever then again had morning sickness from week until the day he was born so idk stork is tempting but do think would trade it for those kicks used to joke that in an ideal world there be desk somewhere that you turn your pee stick in to and they hand you baby my little one is 22 months recently had painful miscarriage and we re trying for another thanks to hormones endorphins etc can only remember the benefits positives of pregnancy know had morning sickness sciatica and will go through labor again but do remember it the way remember having the flu last year or breaking my arm stork had 10 6lb baby and 8lb baby had hyperemesis gravidarum with both bell palsy placenta previa polyhydramnios subchorionic hematoma gallstones which meant had my gallbladder out when my first was newborn and my muscles are still split in the middle had an anterior placenta so it was really hard to feel the kicks stork please had 50+ hour labor attempted forceps resorting to section due to infected waters and then the incision got infected exploding in the middle of the night so tempted by the stork my delivery was easy and fast so gladly do it again the worst part was the prodromal labor that last about days but would do it all again to feel the joy of kick or the joy of skin to skin time if the stork was an option my husband would be getting vasectomy in few hours stork absolutely did even have bad pregnancy but remembering the lack of energy struggling to walk to the end of the block and back stuff like that and constant worrying that every single thing did could have massive repercussions on an innocent baby stork had terrible pregnancy developed antenatal depression and then had traumatic emergency delivery which gave me ptsd and the depression continued if the stork could deliver older than newborn say or even 12 months that would be awesome much prefer my older baby to newborn stork had terrible pregnancy developed antenatal depression and then had traumatic emergency delivery which gave me ptsd and the depression continued if the stork could deliver older than newborn say or even 12 months that would be awesome much prefer my older baby to newborn say sure we can have another kid so long as do have to be pregnant or give birth people do know how to respond to that mean it consider adoption or surrogacy or something before consider being pregnant again like to live in that world please had textbook blissful pregnancy and straightforward 12 hour labour honestly did have single negative no back pain no increased bladder frequency puked once felt baby move from 18 weeks even with an anterior placenta etc do it again in heartbeat if we could financially handle the baby at the end of it my pregnancy was heaven very comfortable and never got sick had scheduled section due to breech position recovery was dream had all positives and no negatives had 10lb 11oz baby vaginally she broke my tailbone on the way out stork also could skip right to 18 months too so loved the kicks but too was sick from week until birth think like the stork please yes but wish pregnancy was shorter it really cool having baby grow in you feeling them but 20 weeks would be great stork stork stork my exhaustion started before even found out was pregnant and knew at weeks so that saying something my hg started at weeks and never went in zofran for it because as soon as had doctor appointment feel better for few days and think was in the clear my heartburn caused me to sleep in my recliner for most of the last months and now my baby is months and still sleeping in the recliner with her on regular basis 30 hours of labor including almost hours of pushing and have had more than hours of sleep consecutively since she was born you think would want any more kids after this one but ve had baby fever since the day she was born stork for sure be very happy to not go through labour birth and the after effects of giving birth bad tear incontinence months later the only thing liked about pregnancy was the sense that was actively creating life wow still blows my mind hmm also my husband did fetch me lot of drinks and food in my third trimester so that was pretty good too still would rather the stork though exploding jeeeez you poor thing that sounds horrific months pregnant now and it really has been bad for me look forward to when get to do it again ha am the opposite am all about being pregnant and giving birth just do want another kid so am signed up to become surrogate my first pregnancy was amazing have bad arthritis and psoriasis and did have single flare up had bad morning sickness but deal with being sick pretty easily she was an emergency section my second pregnancy was terrible he was laying on major artery and kept having dizzy spells and even passed out once was on bed rest for few months until delivery he was planned section but you know what despite the hard times would do it again if was able had to get my tubes tied for medical reasons as much as stork would be nice and love to not deal with monthly visitor the experience of being pregnant is something not everyone gets to have and feel incredibly lucky to have had it stork you are going to feel your kid kicking you for years no need for it to be internal after going through fertility treatment for both pregnancies pregnancy itself was such blessing that the discomforts felt like nothing compared to the emotional financial and physical torture already been through would trade the experience of being pregnant for anything 100 stork still pee if sneeze or cough to hard have lost the baby weight either in the midst of my second pregnancy 30 weeks and am so over it am not one of those glowing pregnant women wish we laid eggs instead honestly loved being pregnant feeling all those kicks and movements was amazing felt gorgeous he months now and the cutest had some terrible morning sickness at the beginning but it stopped around 12 weeks labor was really painful but my epidural worked well once got it and planning to start trying for another in year you made me laugh out loud and almost snort my coffee nicely done think prefer to have transporter for labor and delivery loved being pregnant even with the gd and fatigue and everything else day failed induction that led to horrifying section or push button and baby is magically transported into my arms ll take the button you know hated being pregnant severe hyperemesis that saw me in the hospital multiple times with both sucks but really enjoyed labour and the actual giving birth part so empowering so eh do know when my husband got his vasectomy people were like oh are you *sure* you re done uh yeah *i m* done anyway this baby factory is officially closed my last pregnancy was horror show of unexplained bleeding and preterm labor and bed rest we might decide to expand our family later but refuse to be pregnant again but you have really fast and beautiful labors yes but hour labor does make up for months of misery ya idiots removed mothers of large baby unite stork 41 weeks of being stressed over high risk pregnancy 48 hours of back labor failed epidural section hemorrhage seroma on my incision yep definitely stork one and done unless win the lottery and can afford surrogate hated being pregnant but damnit earned this baby think all the hard work put in growing him makes me feel like deserve him little more well still like the months to prepare so maybe they just give you receipt to come collect the baby later morning sickness nausea waddle walk constantly peeing hip pain diastasis recti stretch mark back pain csection scar 21 questions from everyone exhaustion kicks to the rib ll take the stork please stork there nothing positive about pregnancy except having time to prepare some ladies like the attention fawning over but usually those who like pregnancy experience little to no major symptoms stork have preemies born at 28 weeks so would give anything for stork sometimes miss them being inside of me but having healthy baby is much more important to me then the pregnancy experience mine at least waited until the doctor pushed on the incision when went into the er to explode have thought about what would have done if was at home when that happened what did you do did it hurt mine did not hurt until they went in to debride the wound time has way of romanticizing pregnancy for me actually miss being pregnant now that not and probably will never be again however if you had asked me if would prefer stork deliver the baby when was months along feeling miserable and praying for relief from my symptoms would have eagerly answered yes absolutely loved being pregnant even despite it being difficult to walk having to stop working at 26 weeks being the size of house because carried twins to 39+1 weeks loved carrying them other than the pelvic instability had pain from fall sustained at weeks throughout my entire pregnancy had few other issues had few weeks where dealt with really bad anxiety that would give me racing heartbeat for no reason at all and exhaustion at one point when went anemic but as soon as got that taken care of was fine again labor kind of sucked induction that went well but pushed for hours to no avail decided to just go the section route do it all over in heart beat in fact may just surrogate in the future since twins may be enough kids for us anyway my pregnancy was too bad no throwing up no weird cravings no horrible stretchmarks loved feeling him move around and his little hiccups if it was just the pregnancy would mind going through it again the labor and delivery holy hell jesus christ stork stork all the way removed nah it was experience would have wanted to miss out on even the shitty parts also the glorious high in the first few hours after giving birth would do anything to experience that again except have another baby enjoyed being pregnant currently 38 wks with baby sure there are many downsides get really bad morning sickness in the first trimester and have to be medicated through it otherwise would literally die cant keep water down basically which makes no sense nature and now achey and cant sleep and have done and plan to again unmedicated labour so it ll be super painful too but it special feeling literally growing person inside of you ans cool when you can feel them move and respond to your touch through your tummy and knowing that you are always keeping them safe and well and they are with you so the stork can keep delivering stork babies but prefer my human babies in my tummy there always fostering or adoption for those that truly dislike pregnancy yes am so not baby person always joke that like to pick the baby up at the hospital at months 18 months would be even better eight and half pound baby face up vaginally not great could have been worse ll take skip to 12 months conflicted grew human that amazing but it also sucked lot along the way yay for pregnancy immune suppression it was the only break ve ever had from psoriasis too and probably the top reason thinking of having another pregnancy was hell years later and have physically recovered have permanent injuries to my pelvic joints it did give me brief respite from an autoimmune disorder so there was one positive at least but still go with stork positives outweigh negatives imo it helped me build relationship with my son before ever held him pregnancy was about 000x worse than expected had morning sickness the entire first trimester and then at my 34 week check up was sent to the hospital with preeclampsia after week on hospital bed rest they decided to try to induce me after four days of failed induction while on magnesium drip hell waved the white flag and demanded section was in the hospital another week after that with more blood pressure problems and my baby had to be in nicu special care for 16 days he was totally fine just needed to learn to eat and that seemed like the slowest process ever so yeah would have loved that stork baby want to hate you but that is silly just going to be jealous may you win the lottery so you can have another the kicks were fun at first then my first son somehow got his black belt on the inside and it huuuurt knew and appreciated how lucky was even the complications too much oxytocin so no break between contractions epidural worked too well so could feel anything for almost 24 hours after delivery vacuum assist due to heart decelerations were all either minor or were wrong in the best way too much epidural rather than not enough tend not to share my birth story because it makes others hate me removed how bout weeks did get break from it during my second pregnancy just to forewarn you ditto my pregnancy was pretty textbook but did really like it damn thanks for the heads up though oh yes the sunny side up kind my first was lb 10 oz that way also vaginally her brother weighted the exact same two years later and was face down not even in the same sphere of experiences how is it different good lord that is terrible had wound vac for month they would stick sponge inside my wound and apply pressure to it it would vacuum seal to pull the edges of the wound together had to carry around this pack that had the vacuum inside it and it would keep the pressure on my wound they changed the damn sponge every days and know you know what kind of nightmare that is way way less painful for one and far easier for the one face down the first felt like she was literally breaking my spine even in early labour mine was only lbs and thought was gon na die sunnyside up no thanks one of my biggest fears with trying for second is the notion of managing hg with toddler in the mix how did you do it take just the second trimester you look cute with little round belly and some glow you get some fun kicks and some bonding and then yeah that enough in the same camp as you had to have an emergency section after barely getting to the hospital the nurse discovered that his butt was crowning the hospital has no breech delivery policy was not prepared for an emergency surgery within half an hour after all of that had sweltering apartment for week with temps in the 90 still at 10 pm at night my incision reopened and it took 12 weeks of hell to get it to heal had to go to the wound clinic once week to get it checked on and had nurse come two other days week to repack it since my husband ca handle blood yup they expected my husband to be able to do that stuff to save money fat chance and those protein shakes are disgusting was either in pain too drugged up or too tired to enjoy my baby at all not to mention the one time forgot to take my pain killers before the nurse came it hurt so bad that thought was going to break my jaw with clinching my teeth when my wound was getting repacked ll take the stork any day of the week like my son to have sibling but not sure can commit to it if it going to be anything remotely like the last time hell no so yeah not too interested in having ppd and ppa all over again exact same here except did pee all night do consider the gestational diabetes negative because it made me eat right and gain less weight we will be trying for number two this summer and thrilled to be pregnant again my first was 75 when we got pregnant got medicated immediately made bin of snacks in the pantry and fridge for her and used sitter as much as possible we watched lot of movies let her paint with water colors and play with play doh as much as she wanted when was few months in we put her in part time preschool which helped it was hard but we survived managed my second with different drugs and they seemed to work better good luck like the fast pass at disney get your ticket come back later no waiting my pregnancy seemed to be worse than most people experiences at least the ones who told me about theirs felt great had so much energy and the like felt awful even on diclectin until the day she was born felt hungover the whole damn time labour and delivery was way better than expected though it was long 23 hours including hours of pushing and tiring and of course painful but it was the awful screaming telling my husband hate him kind of ordeal that plenty of people prepared me for wo say it was easy but it was way more enjoyable than actually being pregnant and once it was over talk about sense of accomplishment childbirth was *enjoyable* for you think it awesome year ago after my son was born would have said stork we have been trying to get pregnant while so now say pregnancy is to have gotten twins at months old than newborn lol if only momnesia had morning sickness till 24 weeks lower back pain whenever sat down and 21 hours of unmedicated back labor it funny how when you most correct word there but yeah really did have bad go none of the typical labour horror stories except that did have epidural and the fentanyl did do sfa for me so the last four hours were sans punching and kicking morning sickness since 4w always feeling drained miscarry scares from bleeding pain due to unstable pelvis yes want the stork option 19 weeks along now and would definitely take the stork route if given choice being mom now and having year old so pregnancy behind me glad went thru the pregnancy it makes me look at her differently and remember certain cute moments etc feel like earned her if that makes sense
